core.comp3111

Class LineChartClass

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.comp3111.LineChartClass
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Chart, java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable

    public class LineChartClass
extends java.lang.Object
implements Chart, java.io.Externalizable
    This class used for containing parameters of a Line Chart for clearer structure.
    Author:
    kpor
    See Also:
    DataTable, DataColumn, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Construct a line chart with selected X-axis and Y-axis of a selected DataTable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LineChartClass

        public LineChartClass()
        Construct an empty line chart with no animation.

      • LineChartClass

        public LineChartClass(DataTable currentDataTable,
                      java.lang.String chartXaxisName,
                      java.lang.String chartYaxisName,
                      java.lang.String currentDatasetName,
                      boolean animated)
        Construct a line chart with selected X-axis and Y-axis of a selected DataTable.

        Set the parameter, animated, to create an animated line chart.

        The title of the line chart will be "Line Chart of " plus the name of selected DataTable.

        Parameters:
        currentDataTable - the selected DataTable
        chartXaxisName - name of the selected DataColumn for X-axis
        chartYaxisName - name of the selected DataColumn for Y-axis
        currentDatasetName - name of the selected DataTable
        animated - set true to create an animated line chart

      • writeExternal

        public void writeExternal(java.io.ObjectOutput out)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        The LineChartClass implements the writeExternal method to save its contents by calling the writeObject method of ObjectOutput for strings and numbers.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        out - the stream to write the object to

        java.io.IOException - Includes any I/O exceptions that may occur

      • readExternal

        public void readExternal(java.io.ObjectInput in)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        The LineChartClass implements the readExternal method to restore its contents by calling the readObject method of ObjectOutput for strings and numbers.

        The readExternal method must read the values in the same sequence and with the same types as were written by writeExternal.

        Specified by:
        readExternal in interface java.io.Externalizable
        Parameters:
        in - the stream to read data from in order to restore the object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Includes any I/O exceptions that may occur
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If the class for an object being restored cannot be found
